full_summary:
Public Notice of Zebra Mussel Containment and Treatment Solicitation for Riding Mountain National Park
=====================================================================================

**Solicitation Reference:** 5P420-24-0038/A

**Solicitation Introduction:**
Parks Canada requires an urgent and comprehensive solution to manage and eradicate zebra mussels in Clear Lake, Manitoba. The Solicitation invites Proposals from qualified bidders for the containment and treatment of zebra mussels in the Riding Mountain National Park.

**Project Description:**
The successful bidder will be responsible for designing, installing, and maintaining a containment system to isolate the areas contaminated with zebra mussels. The containment system will be in place for a minimum of 90 days, during which time the aquatic ecosystem will be treated with Potassium Chloride (KCl) to eliminate the zebra mussel population. The treatment area will be approximately 10 to 30 hectares in size, with a maximum depth of 7 meters.

**.selection Criteria:**
Bids will be evaluated based on the following criteria:

* Lowest price
* Quality of the containment system
* Effectiveness of the treatment
* Compliance with the National Parks Regulations

**Timeline:**
The successful bidder is expected to begin work on the project on June 12, 2024, and complete it by November 30, 2024. The contract period will be from the date of contract to November 30, 2024, inclusive.

**Submission and Enquiries:**
Bidders are required to submit their Proposals electronically through the Government of Canada's electronic tendering service (canadabuys.canada.ca). The Solicitation and all associated addenda will be available on the website. Bidders are required to submit their Proposals in either English or French. Bidders who submit their Proposals in English will be responsible for ensuring that the documents are equivalent in both languages.

A technical and contractual session will be held on June 14, 2024, at 14:00 hours MDT to address any questions or concerns. Bidders are responsible for submitting their questions in writing to the Contracting Authority before this date.

**Contact Information:**
For any queries regarding this Solicitation, please contact:

Ryan Taylor
Contact: ryan.taylor@pc.gc.ca
Phone: 587-436-5987
Fax: 1-866-246-6893
